pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.1.8: The six are linen, cotton, silk, wool, sunn hemp, and hemp; see Kd 8:3.1.6. | According to Kd 8:21.1.4 this is no smaller than 8 by 4 sugataṅgula, “standard fingerbreadths”.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.1.18: These are all formally appointed officers of the Sangha. | According to Sp.4.893.16 (commenting on the sekhiya rules) khajjaka refers to all fresh foods: ettha mūlakhādanīyādi sabbaṁ gahetabbaṁ , “Here the fresh foods which are roots, etc. may all be taken.”
